title: Citi Global Consumer Bank Executive Michelle Peluso Appointed to CFPB's Consumer Advisory Board
summary: Citi® Global Consumer Chief Marketing and Internet Officer Michelle Peluso today was appointed to the new Consumer Advisory Board of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB). CFPB Director Rich Cordray announced the composition of the 25-member board today after a seven-month selection process. The CFPB created the Board of consumer experts from outside the federal government to provide advice to CFPB leadership on a broad range of consumer financial issues and emerging market trends.
tag-1: Citi Global Consumer Bank Executive Michelle Peluso Appointed to CFPB's Consumer Advisory Board
tag-2: Citi® Global Consumer Chief Marketing and Internet Officer Michelle Peluso today was appointed to the new Consumer Advisory Board of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB). CFPB Director Rich Cordray announced the composition of the 25-member board today after a seven-month selection process. The CFPB created the Board of consumer experts from outside the federal government to provide advice to CFPB leadership on a broad range of consumer financial issues and emerging market trends.
tag-3: "The CFPB's creation of a Consumer Advisory Board speaks to the Bureau's aim to listen to consumers and constantly adapt to the fast changing consumer environment, goals we strive for passionately at Citi," said Citi Global Consumer Banking Head of Governance and External Affairs John P. Carey. "Michelle has done a remarkable job enhancing the customer experience at Citi and harnessing technology to bring better solutions to customers and companies, and I am confident she will bring that expertise to this important role and help the CFPB achieve its mission."
tag-4: "I am honored to be selected by Director Cordray and the CFPB to join this impressive, diverse group, and I'm eager to help it achieve its important mission," said Peluso. "At Citi we are very supportive of the Bureau's goals to promote transparency and fairness and to ensure consumers are well-informed, and I look forward to doing what I can to help it achieve them."
tag-5: The CFPB Consumer Advisory Board was authorized by Congress through the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act of 2010.
tag-6: In her role as Citi's Global Consumer Chief Marketing and Internet Officer, Peluso is charged with helping monitor and improve the Citi Global Consumer Bank customer experience. She oversees the Global Consumer Bank's marketing and digital teams, including all of its online and mobile banking channels and initiatives. She developed and oversees the organization's social media listening and servicing tools.
tag-7: Prior to joining Citi in 2009, Peluso was CEO of Travelocity from 2003 to 2009. Previously, she served as a White House Fellow and Senior Advisor to Labor Secretary Alexis Herman. She has served on the Board of Directors for Open Table and currently serves on the Board of Directors of the Gilt Groupe. Peluso received her master's degree in economics, philosophy and politics from Pembroke College at Oxford University, where she was a Thoroun Scholar, and her bachelor's degree from the University of Pennsylvania's Wharton School of Business. She lives in New York with her husband, Marc, and their two children, Auden Grace and Cole Hudson.
tag-8: To read the CFPB press release on the Consumer Advisory Board, visit http://www.consumerfinance.gov/newsroom/.
tag-9: Citi Citigroup, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citigroup provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
